detaileddescription.para: Constructor. Initializes the textfield with a given string.

parameterdescription.para: the new text in the TextField.

detaileddescription.para: Draws the caret (the little marker in the text that shows where the letters you type will appear). Easily overloaded if you want to change the style of the caret.

parameterdescription.para: the Graphics object to draw with.

detaileddescription.para: Adjusts the size of the TextField to fit the font size. The constructor taking a string uses this function to initialize the size of the TextField.
Adjusts the height of the text field to fit the font size. The height of the TextField is initialized with this function by the constructors.
Called when the font has changed. If the change is global, this function will only be called if the Widget don't have a font already set.

Draws the Widget. It is called by the parent widget when it is time for the Widget to draw itself. The graphics object is set up so that all drawing is relative to the Widget, i.e coordinate (0,0) is the top-left corner of the Widget. It is not possible to draw outside of a Widgets dimension.

parameterdescription.para: a Graphics object to draw with.

detaileddescription.para: Draws a the Widget border. A border is drawn around a Widget. The width and height of the border is therefore the Widgets height+2*bordersize. Think of a painting that has a certain size, the border surrounds the painting.

parameterdescription.para: a Graphics object to draw with.

detaileddescription.para: Called when a mouse button is pressed when the mouse is in the Widget area or if the Widget has focus.
NOTE: A mouse press is NOT equal to a mouse click. Use mouseClickMessage to check for mouse clicks.

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate of the mouse relative to the Widget itself.
the y coordinate of the mouse relative to the Widget itself.

detaileddescription.para: Called when the mouse moves and the mouse is in the Widget area or if the Widget has focus.

parameterdescription.para: the x coordinate of the mouse relative to the Widget itself.
the y coordinate of the mouse relative to the Widget itself.

detaileddescription.para: Called if a key is pressed when the widget has keyboard focus. If a key is held down the widget will generate multiple key presses.
Scrolls the text horizontally so that the caret shows if needed.
A text field in which you can write or display a line of text.
